name: Vishesh Kumar V.

current_company.name: AECOM
current_company.title: Deputy Project Manager at AECOM New York Metro | New York University | Project Controls | Scheduling | Financial Consultant

experience.title: Deputy Project Manager
experience.description: My responsibilities on this position include, but are not limited to:-Working directly with the Metro NY senior management team, assisting the Project Managers in this region.-Performing financial, economic, and qualitative data collection and analyses of a variety of projects and programs across multiple business lines, including, but not limited to, Transportation, Water, PPM, Buildings + Places, Environment, and Energy.-Create and manage spreadsheets and databases.-Creating reports and presentations in both Excel and PowerPoint, and performing various analytic tasks to support strategy, business / financial planning, and operations.-Responsible for collecting data and preparing various forecasts on key Project and Program financial metrics on a monthly and quarterly basis across the entire Metro NY project and program portfolio.-Monitoring the status of projects and programs, with the ability to understand their relationship and potential impacts to both operational and financial performance.-Supporting corporate initiatives and projects and attend meetings with Metro NY senior management to track and follow-up on action items.-Conducting research and analysis, prepare reports, and make recommendations based on findings-Coordinating with Business Lines and corporate departments to collect and analyze data to prepare reports required by Metro NY senior management.-Supporting Project Managers in managing company project management software systems
experience.description_html: My responsibilities on this position include, but are not limited to:-Working directly with the Metro NY senior management team, assisting the Project Managers in this region.-Performing financial, economic, and qualitative data collection and analyses of a variety of projects and programs across multiple business lines, including, but not limited to, Transportation, Water, PPM, Buildings + Places, Environment, and Energy.-Create and manage spreadsheets and databases.-Creating reports and presentations in both Excel and PowerPoint, and performing various analytic tasks to support strategy, business / financial planning, and operations.-Responsible for collecting data and preparing various forecasts on key Project and Program financial metrics on a monthly and quarterly basis across the entire Metro NY project and program portfolio.-Monitoring the status of projects and programs, with the ability to understand their relationship and potential impacts to both operational and financial performance.-Supporting corporate initiatives and projects and attend meetings with Metro NY senior management to track and follow-up on action items.-Conducting research and analysis, prepare reports, and make recommendations based on findings-Coordinating with Business Lines and corporate departments to collect and analyze data to prepare reports required by Metro NY senior management.-Supporting Project Managers in managing company project management software systems

experience.title: Civil Engineering Intern
experience.description: ‚óè Represented Railways to the contractor on site for a $1.5M RUB (road under bridge) project.‚óè Reduced overall project cost by $50000 with effective project Schedule for all the subcontractors.‚óè Expedited the project completions by 2months with effective planning and management skills.‚óè Performed overall quality assurance of all the different materials used an reported daily project status to the Railways higher officials.‚óè Monitored compliance to applicable codes, practices, QA/QC policies, performance standards and specifications.‚óè Enabled smoother workflow by keeping the Railway track safe and ensured safe running of trains.‚óè Supervised sub-contractors across site locations and ensured coordination between different units of work.

recommendations: Jay Shah ‚ÄúVishesh is a great person to have on the team. His presence keeps the atmosphere light. He is positive. He is humorous. He shows a lot of healthy respect for not just seniors but even colleagues. He has shown a great yearning for learning and is always open to inputs. Constantly wants to keep improving. He has also demonstrated initiative by volunteering to take co-charge of Finwisor ambassador program. Vishesh is an asset to the organization! ‚Äù
publications: [{"title":"Storm Water Management Using Bio-Retention Filter","subtitle":"Lambert Academic Publishing","date":"June 10, 2021","description":"‚Ä¢Published a book with ‚ÄúStorm Water Management Using Bio-Retention Filter‚Äù as a co-author.‚Ä¢ISBN 978-620-3-92433-6 of the Book"},{"title":"Storm water purification in an urban city of India using a Bio-Retention Filter","subtitle":"International Conference on Contemporary and Sustainable Infrastructure ICCSI ‚Äì 2021","date":"May 20, 2021","description":"Research Paper published and presented in International Conference on Contemporary and Sustainable Infrastructure ICCSI ‚Äì 2021ABSTRACTBio-retention filtration system is the leading water conservation strategy that makes use of biogeochemical technique within a vegetation ecosystem to retain soil moisture, purify and conserve storm water in urban cities. The present study was aimed at designing a bio-retention filter basin in Kharghar node of Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. The analysis was carried out for both minor (5-year average recurrence interval) and major (100-year average recurrence interval) floods. Total discharge was computed using the rational formula and it was estimated as 0.023 m3/s for minor flood condition and as 0.037 m3/s for major flood condition. The maximum infiltration rate was computed as 0.0047 m3/s considering sandy loam soil as the filter media. A flow width of 1.6 m was considered in designing the bio-retention filter. 100 mm diameter polyvinyl chloride pipe was proposed as they are the best in terms of performance and have advantage over other pipes. No liner is required for filter according to the soil condition of Kharghar. A transition layer of 100 mm gravel was suggested to provide better efficiency and durability for the bio retention system. The vegetation for the bio-retention basin can be Doob or Bermuda grass (Cynodon dactylon) as it has the highest water retention capacity as per Indian conditions."},{"title":"Design of Bio-retention Filter Basin for Conservation and Purification of Storm water runoff in Urban Areas","subtitle":"International Journal of Recent Technology and Engineering.","date":"December 14, 2020","description":"Research Paper published in International Journal of Recent Technology and Engineering.Link:https://www.ijrte.org/wp-content/uploads/papers/v9i4/D5011119420.pdfABSTRACTUrban areas are more susceptible to water loggingand subsequent flood conditions because of reduced rate ofinfiltration arising from construction activities particularlyduring the monsoon season. However, if the storm water runoff isconserved and purified, it will be useful to cater to the needs of thehuge population in urban areas during the periods of less rainfallor non-monsoon season. Bio-retention basins are bestmanagement practices that use a biogeochemical process within avegetative eco-system to provide soil moisture retention andpurification of storm water. While this structure has beenimplemented in many countries around the world, it is yet to beimplemented in Indian cities with necessary modificationsconsidering the topography, population pressure, hydrologicalcharacteristics of a basin, and the soil and water managementpractices. This project work is oriented to design a bio-retentionfilter basin in the parking lots or roadsides or streetscapes inIndian urban cities"},{"title":"Comparison of Spatio-Temperal Extension of Drought in Three districts of maharashtra, India using SPI","subtitle":"Compliance Engineering Journal","date":"June 18, 2020","description":"Comparison of Spatio-Temperal Extension of Drought in Three districts of maharashtra, India using SPI S. Sangita Mishra(Associate Professor),Vishesh Verma, Divya Sakharle, Kashif Ansari Amity School of Engineering and Technology, Amity University Mumbai Page No: 184-190 DOI:16.10089.CEJ.2020.V11I6.285311.3108ABSTRACTDrought is a recurrent climatic hazard and a major threat to livelihood and socioeconomic development of people. The Marathwada and Vidarbha regions of Maharashtra state has been reeling under frequent drought conditions due to incessant rainfall, dry dams and over-exploitation of groundwater. Thisstudy is aimed to identify type of drought events, estimation of drought severity, duration and spatial and temporal extension of drought to enforce mitigation measures for farmers in the Ahmednagar, Aurangabad and Latur districts of Maharashtra. From the analysis of rainfall for a period of (1930-2001), it was observed that minimum rainfall varied from 355 mm- 400 mm while the maximum rainfall varied from 1042 mm ‚Äì 1158 mm in all three districts for the period under observation. The average annual rainfall varied from 694 mm ‚Äì 836 mm and more than 50% of the years had witnessed below average rainfall in all the three districts. The Standardized Precipitation Index (SPI) was used as the drought severity indicator in this study and the characteristics of droughts were examined for the period from 1930 to 2001. Drought conditions with varied intensity were observed in almost all the years with highest intensity of -2.67 in the Ahmednagar district. Severe and extreme droughts were experienced from time to time across all the three districts that has lead to adverse results on agricultural practices and water resources."}]
